page.title: 16A Bypass for Braintree.
page.content: The town of Braintree in Essex is badly in need of a bypass. This is due to the traffic of 1985 passing through the town en route from the M.11 motorway to the east coast ports. For many years planners have argued about the route and the cost of the bypass. It has now however been agreed to route the new road around the south of the residential area joining Rayne Road to London Road, before joining Coggeshall Road, thus creating a West to East link. Eventually another part will join Coggeshall Road to the A131 giving a complete new road system. Building of the first stage will begin in 1986 with the second phase commencing in 1987. It should be fully complete in 1989. Part of this road construction will be dual carrageway.
